title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito remains unsigned in free agency after opting out of his Red Sox contract following a strong 2025 season.
Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet expressed surprise over Giolito's free agent status, noting his strong performance last year.
The Red Sox strengthened their rotation with additions like Sonny Gray, making a return unlikely for Giolito.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Michael Pittman Jr. of the Colts is a potential trade target for the Patriots, known for his versatility as a wide receiver.
The Patriots may consider DJ Moore from the Bears, a proven deep threat needing possible contract adjustments if traded.
Uchenna Nwosu from the Seahawks could strengthen Patriots' defense; he brings experience and could come with an affordable cap hit.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum remains unsure of his return date after participating in recent five-on-five scrimmages with the Celtics.
Tatum has been practicing with the Maine Celtics and joined team workouts in California but emphasizes a cautious approach.
Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla insists Tatum's return will only happen once he reaches full health, with no formal timeline given.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC Sports' Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko delivered a memorable call for Team USA's gold medal-winning goal in women's hockey.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir highlighted Alysa Liu's gold-medal figure skating performance with disciplined commentary during the Olympics.
NBC's Olympic coverage showcased restraint, allowing athletes' performances to take center stage during key moments like Liu's skating routine.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends free rides on MBTA Routes 23, 28, and 29 through June using remaining federal funds.
Mayor Michelle Wu's initiative began in March 2022, aiming to support key neighborhoods in Boston's recovery.
Future funding of the fare-free program remains uncertain as discussions continue with MBTA and potential state support.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported the highest snowfall with Leyden receiving 6.5 inches by Saturday morning.
Essex County saw Haverhill get up to 5 inches of snow by Saturday morning, among the highest in the county.
The National Weather Service forecasts another storm with possible blizzard conditions and power outages starting Sunday night.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor the victims of the 2013 bombing.
LaRosa, 30, from Canton, has been inspired by a coworker who ran the marathon 24 times.
The 2026 race on April 20 will hold special significance for LaRosa, marking a personal achievement.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac, 38, was sentenced to 15 months in prison for fraudulently obtaining over $1 million in COVID-19 relief funds.
Kirouac used roughly $600,000 in Economic Injury Disaster Loans to purchase the Angus Lea Golf Course in Hillsborough.
Prosecutors stated Kirouac falsely certified that the relief funds were for working capital, misusing them for personal business ventures.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, charged with multiple thefts at Boston's high-end stores along Newbury Street and the Prudential Center.
Cutelis faces charges including four counts of larceny over $1,200 and possession of Class A, B, and C substances.
A judge set bail at $2,500; Cutelis held without bail for a fugitive charge in New Hampshire; next court date March 6.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will be the Red Sox leadoff hitter for the 2026 season, as confirmed by manager Alex Cora.
Anthony excelled in the leadoff spot last season, batting .336 with six home runs and a 1.003 OPS.
Cora's lineup indicates Willson Contreras will bat cleanup, with Trevor Story possibly in the second spot.
